org.gearvrf

Class GVRMesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRMesh
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PrettyPrint

    public class GVRMesh
extends GVRHybridObject
implements PrettyPrint
    Describes an indexed triangle mesh as a set of shared vertices with integer indices for each triangle. Usually each mesh vertex may have a positions, normal and texture coordinate. Skinned mesh vertices will also have bone weights and indices. If the mesh uses a normal map for lighting, it will have tangents and bitangents as well. These vertex components correspond to vertex attributes in the OpenGL vertex shader.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getVertices

        public float[] getVertices()
        Get the 3D vertices of the mesh. Each vertex is represented as a packed float triplet:

        { x0, y0, z0, x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2, ... }

        Returns:
        Array with the packed vertex data.

      • setVertices

        public void setVertices(float[] vertices)
        Sets the 3D vertices of the mesh. Each vertex is represented as a packed float triplet:

        { x0, y0, z0, x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2, ...}

        Parameters:
        vertices - Array containing the packed vertex data.

      • getNormals

        public float[] getNormals()

        { x0, y0, z0, x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2, ...}

        Returns:
        Array with the packed normal data.

      • setNormals

        Parameters:
        normals - Array containing the packed normal data.

      • getTexCoords

        public float[] getTexCoords()
        Get the u,v texture coordinates for the mesh. Each texture coordinate is represented as a packed float pair:

        { u0, v0, u1, v1, u2, v2, ...}

        Returns:
        Array with the packed texture coordinate data.

        Parameters:
        texCoords - Array containing the packed texture coordinate data.

      • getTriangles

        public char[] getTriangles()
        Deprecated. use getIndices() instead.
        Get the triangle vertex indices of the mesh. The indices for each triangle are represented as a packed char triplet, where t0 is the first triangle, t1 is the second, etc.:

        { t0[0], t0[1], t0[2], t1[0], t1[1], t1[2], ...}

        Returns:
        Array with the packed triangle index data.

      • setTriangles

        public void setTriangles(char[] triangles)
        Deprecated. use setIndices(char[]) instead.
        Sets the triangle vertex indices of the mesh. The indices for each triangle are represented as a packed int triplet, where t0 is the first triangle, t1 is the second, etc.:

        { t0[0], t0[1], t0[2], t1[0], t1[1], t1[2], ...}

        Parameters:
        triangles - Array containing the packed triangle index data.

      • getIndices

        public char[] getIndices()
        Get the vertex indices of the mesh. The indices for each vertex to be referenced.
        Returns:
        Array with the packed index data.

        Parameters:

      • getSphereBound

        public void getSphereBound(float[] sphere)
        Calculate a bounding sphere from the mesh vertices.
        Parameters:
        sphere - float[4] array to get center of sphere and radius; sphere[0] = center.x, sphere[1] = center.y, sphere[2] = center.z, sphere[3] = radius

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if attribute exists, false if not

      • getBoundingBox

        public GVRMesh getBoundingBox()
        Constructs a mesh that contains this mesh.

        This is primarily useful with the GVRPicker, which does "ray casting" to detect which scene object you're pointing to. Ray casting is computationally expensive, and you generally want to limit the number of triangles to check. A simple quad is cheap enough, but with complex meshes you will probably want to cut search time by registering the object's bounding box, not the whole mesh.

        Returns:
        A GVRMesh of the bounding box.

      • createCurvedMesh

        public static GVRMesh createCurvedMesh(GVRContext gvrContext,
                                       int width,
                                       int height,
                                       float centralAngle,
                                       float radius)
        A static method to generate a curved mesh along an arc. Note the width and height arguments are used only as a means to get the width:height ratio.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - the current context
        width - a number representing the width
        height - a number representing the height
        centralAngle - the central angle of the arc
        radius - the radius of the circle
        Returns:
        An object of GVRMesh
